It's a pain to fast forward an YouTube video or some smartphone apps (e.g. YuppTV), but it's a a breeze with FireTV Stick.
author: S. Ghantasala

review: So far so good. I have the Apple TV and the Roku Box. So I am very familiar with these types of sets. I even had the Chromcast before I gave to my sister. This was a really easy one to set up. And the remote is nice and sleek, albeit, a bit to sensitive. I got this when it was on sale for $19 for Prime members. I like that it gives me really easy and fast access to all the video that I have through my Prime account. Before this I used the app on the Roku and it was slow and buggy. I do hope that Amazon expands that app library to include HBO Go and a few other missing ones. The one complaint I have is that I also bought the Fire Tablet 6 Inch and the app for the Fire TV does not work on it (cannot even install it). This is a very strange move by Amazon, which I hope they correct real soon. Besides that, I think that if you are an Amazon Prime member and deciding between this and the others, this one definitely is worth the buy.

review: As a Prime member I was looking forward to the release of the Fire TV Stick. Unfortunately, it did not work as promoted. Despite using it on the same television as a Chromecast, and knowing how to set the connection, it still did not work. I enjoyed having the controller over using my iphone but every time I selected a television show, movie, or other selection I got a message stating the wi-fi connection was lost or the loading circle would turn and turn but never arrive at the show (even after waiting 15 minutes). The final straw was after a week of trying to watch something using this "stick" it began stating that our connection was too slow but it is fast enough for 2 PS4s, a gaming PC, and our Chromecast.Amazon needs to send this item back to the developers and get it fixed before selling any more.
author: P. W. Edwards
